eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils

Class Classification

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils.Classification

  • public class Classification
extends Object
    Parser for a (possibly multi-tier, hierarchical) classification scheme (category/subcategory/...). ASSUMPTION: Each category (at any level) must have a unique name, which is being used as its key the derived dictionary.
    Version:
    1.4
    Author:
    Kostas Patroumpas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Map<String,Category> categories
      Dictionary for all categories and their parents; their name is used as the key in searching.
      Map<String,String> categoryUUIDs
      Auxiliary dictionary for searching the artificial UUID (value) of a given original category identifier (key).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Classification(Configuration config, String outFile)
      Constructor of the classification hierarchy representation

    • Constructor Detail

      • Classification

        public Classification(Configuration config,
                      String outFile)
        Constructor of the classification hierarchy representation
        Parameters:
        config - User-specified configuration for the transformation process.
        outFile - Output file containing the RDF triples resulted from transformation of the classification scheme.

    • Method Detail

      • parseYMLFile

        public void parseYMLFile(String classificationFile)
        Parses input YML file containing the classification hierarchy
        Parameters:
        classificationFile - Path to YML file specifying the classification scheme. ASSUMPTION: Each line in the YML file corresponds to a category; levels are marked with a number of indentation characters at the beginning of each line; no indentation signifies a top-tier category.

      • parseCSVFile

        public void parseCSVFile(String classificationFile)
        Parses input CSV file containing the classification hierarchy
        Parameters:
        classificationFile - Path to CSV file specifying the classification scheme. ASSUMPTION: Each line (record) corresponds to a full path from the top-most to the bottom-most category; at each level, two attributes are given: first a (usually numeric) identifier, then the name of the category. ASSUMPTION: This CSV file must use ',' as delimiter character between attributes values enclosed in double quotes ("..."). EXAMPLE ROW for a 3-tier classification: 1,"Food",103,"Restaurant",103005,"Chinese Restaurant".

      • search

        public Category search(String categoryName)
        For a given category name, finds the respective entry in the classification scheme
        Parameters:
        categoryName - The category name to search in the classification hierarchy. Category names must be unique amongst all levels.
        Returns:
        The entry in the classification scheme representation corresponding to the given category

      • getUUID

        public String getUUID(String categoryName)
        For a given category name, identifies its respective UUID in the classification scheme
        Parameters:
        categoryName - The category name to search in the classification hierarchy. Category names must be unique amongst all levels.
        Returns:
        The UUID corresponding to this category in the classification scheme

      • findUUID

        public String findUUID(String categoryId)
        For a given category identifier in the classification scheme, find its respective UUID
        Parameters:
        categoryId - The original category identifier to search in the classification hierarchy. Category identifiers must be unique amongst all levels.
        Returns:
        The UUID corresponding to this category identifier in the classification scheme

      • countCategories

        public int countCategories()
        Returns the number of categories in the dictionary representation of the classification scheme
        Returns:
        Total number of categories at all levels

      • printHierarchyYML

        public void printHierarchyYML()
        Prints the entire classification scheme representation to the standard output in a YML-like fashion
